2. Congenital nystagmus: This is a condition characterized by involuntary, rapid, and repetitive eye movements, usually present from birth. It is also considered an atypical phenotype of certain eye diseases.
3. Aniridia: This is a rare genetic condition characterized by the absence of the iris in the eye. It is considered a recognizable phenotype of certain eye diseases.
